abstract: As chatter rises over the prospect of a General Electric–Pearson bid for Dow Jones, many have been wondering how that combination could possibly trump News Corporation‘s $60-a-share offer. Most analysts and pundits see Rupert Murdoch’s bid, worth about $5 billion, as too rich to be beaten. The septuagenarian media mogul could also open his wallet even wider, according to common wisdom.
lead_paragraph: As chatter rises over the prospect of a General Electric–Pearson bid for Dow Jones, many have been wondering how that combination could possibly trump News Corporation‘s $60-a-share offer. Most analysts and pundits see Rupert Murdoch’s bid, worth about $5 billion, as too rich to be beaten. The septuagenarian media mogul could also open his wallet even wider, according to common wisdom.

headline.main: Could an Underbid Win Dow Jones?
